sentences.sentence: The U.S. calls for restraint over China's military exercises near Taiwan. It's after eight Chinese warships and 71 planes were detected on Saturday near Taiwan, according to the island's Ministry of Defense. The three-day Chinese military exercise is in retaliation for a meeting last week between the U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Kevin McCarthy and the president of the self-rude democracy claimed by Beijing, Tai Ying-Wan. Gallagher says he wants Congress to work on stepping up its military commitments to Taiwan. However, China had warned U.S. lawmakers not to have the meeting and now warns America against what it calls a wrong and dangerous road. On Saturday, the Taiwanese Navy warned the Navy ships that they were harming regional peace, stability and security and asked them to turn around and leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.sentence: Bugün, Good Friday Belfast Agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It brought an end to a war lasting almost 30 years between Irish Catholics and British Protestants over the status of Northern Ireland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But as Ken Murray reports, while there is a welcome peace, progress across a range of political issues has been frustrating and slow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Joe O'Donnell walks along a specially constructed peace wall in Belfast that still separates working-class British Protestants from neighbouring Irish Catholics. He says while the 1998 Good Friday Agreement brought peace to Northern Ireland it has not eased tensions. I don't think anybody would say that the peace process 25 years on has delivered in its entirety and it probably hasn't delivered as much as people would have hoped for or expected after 25 years. 1998 with over 47,000 people injured. For the generation born in 1998 who have not experienced daily violence, they feel that the peace agreement is still not delivering what it promised.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I feel it's definitely delivered a bit, but there's definitely more work that could be done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have relatively peace and I feel very privileged to experience that. You know, if I listen to my parents, they talk about very terrible times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Obviously, the political process is another question. Storming's been down more than it's been up. So that's something I think is frustrating for people here. The Northern Ireland Parliament is currently not sitting in a row over the fallout from Brexit, with unionists feeling they have been isolated from Great Britain. Experienced observers take the view that while the agreement delivered some progress between the two divided communities, the 1998 peace agreement remains one of the most respected models of conflict resolution in the entire world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Many nationalists and many unionists find there are things in the Good Friday Agreement they don't particularly like, but viewed from other conflicts, other parts of the world, the achievement of substantial peace in what seemed like an intractable conflict, in what seemed like one of those conflicts that simply would not end, is a remarkable achievement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There are over 100 peace walls here in Belfast, just like this one, which separate pro-Irish Catholics from pro-British Protestants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The very fact that these walls exist at all is living proof that when it comes to the full implementation of the 1998 peace agreement, there's still plenty of more work to be done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is Ken Murray for Euronews in Belfast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Czech believers have revived an old Easter tradition, the rattling procession.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Participants in black suits with white masks march through the southern Czech Republic city of České Budějovice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: From Maundy Thursday to Holy Saturday they walk through the town with drums, clappers and rolling wooden rattles to mark the rhythm of the day. The deafening sound replaces the bells which have gone to Rome to be blessed by the Pope for the following year's work, according to tradition.
